rm_story.acceptance_criteria: An archive table contains all of the data from this table. The table has significantly less than 10,000 rows. The workman job can run.
rm_story.description: Problem Statement: The Sovera application will only allow a maximum of 10,000 rows in this table. We exceeded 10,000 rows in late April 2015. Now, the "workman" job will not run. Resolution: An archive table already exists for this purpose. We need to truncate the archive table and re-populate it with the current data. The Cash team already has a function to be able to remove unwanted data from the table. They will use that to clean out older entries.

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: users have the ability to select a focus unit (facility) if record is null in the database but required in the UI.
rm_story.description: Problem Statement : Oliver Web UI user Miranda Sellman got an error "ORA-2002: Null Focus Unit Abbreviation not allowed." when trying to Post a payment to Unallocated in the Exception Processing Screen. RMP ID - 4243069 Root Cause : The "POST" button in EP calls the stored procedure PKG_OLV_WEBAPP_EP.P_UPDATE_TRANS for posting the transaction. This procedure expects an input for FOCUSUNITABBR. This is supplied by the stored Procedure PKG_OLV_WEBAPP_EP.P_SELECTCLAIMS for the UI. In this case for Transaction ID = 41502385 (RMP ID – 4243069) the FOCUSUNITABBR was NULL and it threw an exception saying "Null Focus Unit Abbreviation not allowed". Solution : This should either be a data-fix in the FOCUS_CLAIMS table or it has to be taken as a code-fix to handle/ allow NULL Focus Unit Abbreviations in the PKG_OLV_WEBAPP_EP.P_UPDATE_TRANS. I leave it to the DB team to research on further options. Please update Exception Processing and Transaction Entry to allow a user to select the correct facility (Focus Unit) when the facility is NULL but required.
rm_story.short_description: P4 - Field Validation Error for Null Focus Unit Abbr CR872 REL#0415L

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: button should work for all users
rm_story.description: When in DMM to map a Paper Denials Detail screen if a mapping needs to be applied to only the claim shown, the button under 'Apply Mapping To' -> 'This Claim Only' is not working. Each time this button is clicked and the Map button is clicked there is an error message that comes up that states 'Your Current Session Timed Out' and the item is not mapped. This is happening for all teammates on DMT that try to only map a claim under 'This Claim Only' button. Original ticket: INC0635720
rm_story.short_description: P3 - Oliver DMM Paper Error 'This Claim Only': REL#TBD

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: user have the ability to search when grid count is over 3000
rm_story.description: the Telerik control needs to be updated to the latest version. Bug in current version does not allow filtering when the total amount of records is more then 3000 Work around put in place to bypass Telerik as we were unable to upgrade due to our IE version. Updated how refresh works in searching and changed loading behavior. Batch Manager now works with more then 3k records

rm_story.description: Upgrade Telerik ASP.NET Web UI tools from 2009 edition to 2015 Q3 Edition to improve Async loading, Sorting & Filtering in Oliver System.

rm_story.description: Defects found when testing all ROPS apps with IE11. Defects with High status do not work with Enterprise mode turned on.

Automation of Oliver Reconciliation Processes the following manual reconciliation processes need to be automated 1) Printed Claim Pages through Sovera - Need reconciliation that all claim pages printed/sent via Nautalus or Focus have been received by Sovera or current Imaging System.
rm_story.short_description: WL#697 - Automation of Claim Image Reconciliation Processes:REL#0515E

rm_story.description: for phase 1 we will only be doing 835 oliver -> Sovera recon Details of PDF Generation and requested process in attached SRS Manual and/or Automated reconciliation is needed for various file types that process in and out of Oliver and Sovera The following is needed: File Type PUB SUB PDF Oliver Interlin/Uniface PDF Interlink/Uniface Sovera/Filenet
rm_story.short_description: Create Reconciliation of PDF Remits in Oliver:

rm_story.description: 1. GetUACashBalance should return NULL for no Unallocated entries: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Oliver has exposed GetUACashBalance service to NS. This service returns the balance of the unallocated amount for a patient. It returns a balance as zero even when there are no unallocated entries in Oliver. Instead, it needs to return NULL. To summarize: If unallocated entries exist then Return the balance (zero or +ive balance or –ive balance) else Return as NULL end ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ James Robert's analysis on 4/13/2015 I don't see any impact on DB side because the procedure already sending the null if no records found for the MPI or returns the sum of "transaction_amt". Here is the query : SELECT SUM(ucd.transaction_amt) total_balance_amount INTO po_total_balance_amt FROM unallocated_cash_dtls ucd INNER JOIN party_roles pat_pr ON (ucd.patient_pr_seq_no = pat_pr.pr_seq_no) WHERE pat_pr.identifier = pi_MPI AND ucd.sts_cd = PKG_OLV_CONSTANTS.C_UCDTL_EXPORTED; But there is an impact on the web services which access the procedure in "public class UACashRepository" (UACashRepository.cs) in TFS "OliverWS/OliverWS/Repository/Unallocated". public Double GetUABalance(string MPI) { using (OracleCommand command = new OracleCommand()) { command.CommandText = "PKG_OLV_UNALLOCATED.p_get_total_unalloc_cash"; Db.AddInParameter(command, "pi_MPI", DbType.String, MPI); Db.AddOutParameter(command, "po_total_balance_amt", DbType.Double, 50); command.CommandType = CommandType.StoredProcedure; Object obj = Db.ExecuteScalar(command); Object objBalance = NormalizeValue(Db.GetParameterValue(command, "po_total_balance_amt")); if (objBalance == null ) throw new FaultException("Invalid MPI"); return Convert.ToDouble(objBalance.ToString()); } } The exception has been handled and throws the message "Invalid MPI" (highlighted), if the return value is NULL. We have to make code changes to accommodate this requirement. 2. Use balance amt for Unallocated total balance: ----------------------------------------------------------------------- Problem: Unallocated total balance is not matching with total of unallocated header records. There are two web methods (one to provide the Total unallocated amount for the MPI and another one to provide the header records which provides total unallocated amount for aggregated data based on payor, center, group period) exposed in Oliver for NS to consume it. Detail: Avinash requested data for all scenario to test the story "STRY0015656" (Test Unallocated total balance for MPI). I was working on to provide the data and did some sanity check to make sure is everything looks good. The total unallocated amount is not matching between these two methods. Root cause: Based on the further analysis on the code, total unallocated amount provided by "Unallocated total balance for the MPI" is referring transaction amount field whereas "total of unallocated header" is referring "Balance amount" field. Solution: Balance amount needs to be used in unallocated total balance method.
rm_story.short_description: GetUACashBalance should return NULL for no Unallocated entries + Use balance amt for Unallocated total balance
[STRY0015919] Analyze where Oliver post PLBs to Claims instead of GL (for Rania)

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: The MCBD rule engine should attempt to find images on the schedule that's described in this story (or the SRS).
rm_story.description: Currently, if rules engine does not find an 835 in Imaging, it will check back in 12 hours, and then again in 5 hours. In two states, we found examples in which the 835 came available in Imaging in 24 to 30 hours later. System should check back more than 17 hours after the initial search. (see CA claim examples 20067219-2, 20110379-2, 20109794-2, 20133635-2; LA claim 19756068-2) Recommendation: System should check for an 835 in Imaging 12 hours after not being able to find it, and in the eventuality that it cannot locate the Image at that point it should check again every 24 hours for 5 days. Only after all checks have passed without successfully locating the appropriate image should the system drop the claim to the PRR queue for manual resolution.
rm_story.short_description: MCBD: Change wait times for 835 Image retrieval

rm_story.description: This story references incident: INC0628396 / Quality Center item: QC520 And, it has this corresponding fix in the Nautilus application. STRY0013873 : INC0657014 - Add Container Status Code to the Payer Entity Publication to Reggie
rm_story.short_description: NS/Oliver Plan Code interface is missing data elements [INC0628396/QC520]

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: All scheduled jobs will use the "dba_scheduler_jobs" method. All scheduled jobs will continue to run correctly.
rm_story.description: Problem Statement: The scheduled jobs in Oracle are using two different methods. The older method does not track historical data for each run, which can cause problems when troubleshooting issues. This also causes some additional overhead in maintenance and monitoring. Job List:- dba_jobs - Dba_Scheduler_Jobs 720158 - PROCESS_DENIAL_MCBD_XML 720161 - MCBD_PTSTMT_JOB 720164 - update_denial_mcbd_details 720167 - schedule_jobs_initiator 734815 - focus_to_oliver 735575 - MCBD_JOB 1063281 - ProcessClaimHeaderFeeds 798195 - 798197 - Resolution: We need to move the job that use the old "dba_jobs" method to the newer "dba_scheduler_jobs" method.

FG #1: BBA - Illinois Secondary 835's are indexed as Tertiary. For packet construction, system needs to include this doc type and include in packet creation. ** BBA - New York Documents scanned to ERA secondary but indexed as ERA primary - Should we consider these when evaluating for MCBD and packet creation?
FG #1: BBA - Alabama Add NPI D01 as an additional NPI for state to process remit

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: The email content will remain the same. The emails will be sent to a specific Email Distribution List
rm_story.description: When OFE has an error, it sends an alert email. Currently, OFE is configured to send these emails to a list of individuals. Instead, OFE should send them to this Email Distribution List: IT ROPS - Monitor Alerts Cash Email Example: Oliver File Engine execution started on machine SEA-OLVBKG01 at 5/7/2015 7:30:00 PM. Full run of all import modules started at 5/7/2015 7:30:00 PM. Raw 835 import started at 5/7/2015 7:30:00 PM. Error Number: 5 Error Source: Oracle Data Provider for .NET ORA-20100: Unable to start execution of module Import 835. Verify another process is not running and that the prior execution did not raise an exception. ORA-06512: at "PFSPROD_CUSTOM.PKG_OLVFE_SHARED", line 75 ORA-06512: at line 1 IMPORTANT: Oliver File Engine will not run again until exception is cleared. at Oracle.DataAccess.Client.OracleException.HandleErrorHelper(Int32 errCode, OracleConnection conn, IntPtr opsErrCtx, OpoSqlValCtx* pOpoSqlValCtx, Object src, String procedure) at Oracle.DataAccess.Client.OracleException.HandleError(Int32 errCode, OracleConnection conn, String procedure, IntPtr opsErrCtx, OpoSqlValCtx* pOpoSqlValCtx, Object src) at Oracle.DataAccess.Client.OracleCommand.ExecuteNonQuery() at _OliverClassLib.SharedUtils.ModuleStartExecution(Int32 iModuleID) in C:\TFS\Oliver\Development\Maintenance\Oliver File Engine\OliverClassLib\SharedUtils.vb:line 581 at _OliverClassLib.Import835.ImportRaw835ToDB(Boolean bBackloadOnly) in C:\TFS\Oliver\Development\Maintenance\Oliver File Engine\OliverClassLib\Import835.vb:line 570 at _OliverFileEngine.frmOliverFileEngineActions.RunImportRaw835(Boolean bBackloadOnly) in C:\TFS\Oliver\Development\Maintenance\Oliver File Engine\OliverFileEngine\frmOliverFileEngineActions.vb:line 483 at _OliverFileEngine._835FileEngineStartUp.RunImportModules(frmOliverFileEngineActions& o835FileEngineActions) in C:\TFS\Oliver\Development\Maintenance\Oliver File Engine\OliverFileEngine\OliverFileEngineStartUp.vb:line 93 at _OliverFileEngine._835FileEngineStartUp.Main(String[] argv) in C:\TFS\Oliver\Development\Maintenance\Oliver File Engine\OliverFileEngine\OliverFileEngineStartUp.vb:line 350 Oliver File Engine execution terminated on machine SEA-OLVBKG01 at 5/7/2015 7:30:00 PM.
rm_story.short_description: OFE Alerts being sent to wrong email addresses

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: OFE continues to function as it does today. Field and Data information is included in the error log.
rm_story.description: Problem statement: When OFE has an error, it only logs the basic error message. It does not include the specific field or data that caused the failure. This is cause a huge investigation task to troubleshoot problems. Resolution: Include the Field and Data information in the error log when OFE has an exception.
rm_story.short_description: OFE: Improve error handling by logging Field data

rm_story.acceptance_criteria: Files do not go to ER status.
rm_story.description: there are some instances where a valid 835 file can not be loaded into Oliver and the matching logic fails to run. these files will be set to a ER status in the RMP table. Once in ER status they are not avaiable to be worked by the business. Need to resolve this error so all files can be successfully imported into Oliver. after further research it was found that this is specifically happening when three is a cross over claim matching and the secondary claim already exists in Nautilus. Nautilus is sending back a "false" to the generation request from Oliver. this false response is throwing the error.

rm_story.short_description: Help DBA on new schemas for QA
